clusters.title: Macron to host Ukraine's Zelensky in Paris on November 17
clusters.neutral_headline: Kyiv Hit by Russian Strikes, Zelenskyy Says Attacks Calculated
bullet_summary: Almost every district of Ukraine’s capital Kyiv came under a “massive” attack on Friday, Mayor Vitaly Klitschko said
Russia fired missiles and drones at energy, rail and other critical infrastructure, officials said, amid intensified strikes since its 2022 invasion
Dozens of people were wounded in the attacks, including a child and a pregnant woman, the president said

items.title: Macron to host Ukraine's Zelensky in Paris on November 17
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will be returning to Paris on November 17 for his ninth trip to France since Russia's full-scale invasion began in 2022, the office of French President Emmanuel Macron said Friday.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will be returning to Paris on November 17 for his ninth trip to France since Russia's full-scale invasion began in 2022, the office of French President Emmanuel Macron said Friday.

items.title: Russia's massive attack on Kyiv kills at least 4 people, injures dozens of others
items.standfirst: At least 430 drones and 18 missiles were used in the overnight attack, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.
items.content: At least 430 drones and 18 missiles were used in the overnight attack, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.(Image credit: Evgeniy Maloletka)

items.title: Zelensky: Russian strike on Kiev 'calculated'
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Friday that the Russian overnight strike on Kiev, which killed four people and left dozens wounded, was "deliberately calculated" and "aimed at causing m...
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Friday that the Russian overnight strike on Kiev, which killed four people and left dozens wounded, was "deliberately calculated" and "aimed at causing m...

items.title: Explosions rock Kyiv as mayor reports ‘massive’ Russian strikes across the capital
items.standfirst: Almost every district of Ukraine’s capital Kyiv came under a “massive” attack on Friday, Mayor Vitaly Klitschko said. The attack killed at least one person and wounded at least 15 more, according to emergency services. Russia fired missiles and drones at energy, rail and other critical infrastructure, officials said, amid intensified strikes since its 2022 invasion.
items.content: Almost every district of Ukraine’s capital Kyiv came under a “massive” attack on Friday, Mayor Vitaly Klitschko said. The attack killed at least one person and wounded at least 15 more, according to emergency services. Russia fired missiles and drones at energy, rail and other critical infrastructure, officials said, amid intensified strikes since its 2022 invasion.

items.title: ‘Massive enemy attack’: Russia pounds Ukraine’s Kyiv, killing four
items.standfirst: President Zelenskyy says dozens also wounded as Moscow launched some 430 drones and 18 missiles.
items.content: President Zelenskyy says dozens also wounded as Moscow launched some 430 drones and 18 missiles.

items.title: Explosions rock Kyiv as mayor reports ‘massive’ Russian strikes across the capital
items.standfirst: A "calculated" barrage of Russian drones and missiles across Ukraine killed at least four people, President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday, with Kyiv Mayor Vitaly Klitschko saying that almost every district of the capital had been hit. Dozens of people were wounded in the attacks, including a child and a pregnant woman, the president said.
items.content: A "calculated" barrage of Russian drones and missiles across Ukraine killed at least four people, President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday, with Kyiv Mayor Vitaly Klitschko saying that almost every district of the capital had been hit. Dozens of people were wounded in the attacks, including a child and a pregnant woman, the president said.

ai_summary: Russian strikes on Kyiv killed at least four people and injured dozens on Friday.
Ukrainian President Zelenskyy called the attacks "deliberately calculated" by Russia.
Mayor Klitschko reported "massive" strikes across almost every Kyiv district.
Emergency services reported at least one death and fifteen injuries in Kyiv.
Russia fired missiles and drones at energy and critical infrastructure in Kyiv.

clusters.title: Blue Origin's New Glenn rocket deploys Mars satellites, sticks booster landing
clusters.neutral_headline: Blue Origin Launches New Glenn Rocket, Lands Booster Successfully
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, BBC World, CBS News and others

items.title: Blue Origin's New Glenn rocket deploys Mars satellites, sticks booster landing
items.standfirst: Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin successfully launched its New Glenn rocket on Thursday with NASA twin spacecraft destined for Mars aboard, and in a breakthrough nailed the landing of its booster.
items.content: Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin successfully launched its New Glenn rocket on Thursday with NASA twin spacecraft destined for Mars aboard, and in a breakthrough nailed the landing of its booster.

items.title: Watch: Blue Origin rocket successfully lands booster for first time
items.standfirst: Jeff Bezos' space company saw its first successful return landing of a reusable booster - a feat that SpaceX pioneered.
items.content: Jeff Bezos' space company saw its first successful return landing of a reusable booster - a feat that SpaceX pioneered.

items.title: Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin launches NASA Mars spacecraft on first New Glenn flight
items.standfirst: Jeff Bezos’s Blue Origin launched its New Glenn rocket on Thursday carrying NASA’s twin Mars-bound spacecraft, and in a major milestone successfully landed its booster for reuse. The launch, delayed for days by weather, marked only the second New Glenn flight and the first booster recovery by a company other than SpaceX.
items.content: Jeff Bezos’s Blue Origin launched its New Glenn rocket on Thursday carrying NASA’s twin Mars-bound spacecraft, and in a major milestone successfully landed its booster for reuse. The launch, delayed for days by weather, marked only the second New Glenn flight and the first booster recovery by a company other than SpaceX.

items.title: Blue Origin's New Glenn launches twin Mars probes
items.standfirst: Blue Origin, owned by Jeff Bezos, plans to challenge SpaceX with the powerful, partially reusable New Glenn rocket.
items.content: Blue Origin, owned by Jeff Bezos, plans to challenge SpaceX with the powerful, partially reusable New Glenn rocket.

items.title: Bezos' Blue Origin Successfully Lands Booster After Rocket Launch
items.standfirst: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin launched its New Glenn rocket from Florida into space and successfully landed its first-stage booster rocket on a barge in the Atlantic Ocean. It's a historic mission. The rocket will send two spacecraft on a trajectory toward Mars. The booster landing is key to Blue Origin’s goal of making New Glenn partially reusable. Recovered boosters would be recycled for multiple launches. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin launched its New Glenn rocket from Florida into space and successfully landed its first-stage booster rocket on a barge in the Atlantic Ocean. It's a historic mission. The rocket will send two spacecraft on a trajectory toward Mars. The booster landing is key to Blue Origin’s goal of making New Glenn partially reusable. Recovered boosters would be recycled for multiple launches. (Source: Bloomberg)

ai_summary: Blue Origin launched its New Glenn rocket with NASA Mars spacecraft aboard.
The launch marked the second New Glenn flight and first booster recovery.
Blue Origin successfully landed its booster for reuse, a major milestone.
The rocket will send two spacecraft on a trajectory toward Mars.
The booster landing is key to Blue Origin’s goal of reusability.

clusters.title: Reeves decides against raising income tax rates
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Chancellor Reeves Abandons Income Tax Hike Plans
bullet_summary: Reported by BBC Top Stories, Guardian World, Reuters Top News

items.title: Reeves decides against raising income tax rates
items.standfirst: The chancellor had been widely expected to increase income tax rates, which would have broken a manifesto promise.
items.content: The chancellor had been widely expected to increase income tax rates, which would have broken a manifesto promise.

items.title: Treasury considering lowering thresholds for higher rates of income tax in budget – UK politics live
items.standfirst: A source told the Guardian that plans to break the manifesto pledge on income tax had been ditched by the chancellorThis is from Helen Miller, director of the Institute for Fiscal Studies thinktank, on the market reaction to the chancellor’s reported budget U-turn.Investors will have 2 broad concerns about news that Chancellor won’t increase income tax rates1. Does it signal less willingness to do politically difficult thingsBritain’s long-term borrowing costs were sent soaring as reports suggested the latest U-turn would leave Rachel Reeves scrambling to fill a gaping black hole in the nation’s finances just two weeks before the 26 November budget.Yields on 30-year UK government bonds, also known as gilts, jumped as much as 14 basis points in early trading, and the yield on 10-year gilts also shot up 12 basis points – rising the most since July. Continue reading...
items.content: A source told the Guardian that plans to break the manifesto pledge on income tax had been ditched by the chancellorThis is from Helen Miller, director of the Institute for Fiscal Studies thinktank, on the market reaction to the chancellor’s reported budget U-turn.Investors will have 2 broad concerns about news that Chancellor won’t increase income tax rates1. Does it signal less willingness to do politically difficult thingsBritain’s long-term borrowing costs were sent soaring as reports suggested the latest U-turn would leave Rachel Reeves scrambling to fill a gaping black hole in the nation’s finances just two weeks before the 26 November budget.Yields on 30-year UK government bonds, also known as gilts, jumped as much as 14 basis points in early trading, and the yield on 10-year gilts also shot up 12 basis points – rising the most since July. Continue reading...

items.title: Pound falls and UK borrowing costs rise as Reeves ditches plans for income tax hike – business live
items.standfirst: Jitters over the UK’s autumn budget grow as chancellor Rachel Reeves abandons plans to raise income tax on 26 November The pound is now trading down just 0.24% versus the dollar at around £1.3159.The 10-year gilt yield is now up 0.06 percentage points at 4.49%Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves has been able to drop plans to raise income taxes because she received an improved fiscal forecast from the UK’s budget watchdog, people familiar with the matter said.The latest update from the Office for Budget Responsibility moved in a significantly more favorable direction due to the strength of government receipts and stronger wage performance, the people said, asking not to be named discussing sensitive matters. Continue reading...
items.content: Jitters over the UK’s autumn budget grow as chancellor Rachel Reeves abandons plans to raise income tax on 26 November The pound is now trading down just 0.24% versus the dollar at around £1.3159.The 10-year gilt yield is now up 0.06 percentage points at 4.49%Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves has been able to drop plans to raise income taxes because she received an improved fiscal forecast from the UK’s budget watchdog, people familiar with the matter said.The latest update from the Office for Budget Responsibility moved in a significantly more favorable direction due to the strength of government receipts and stronger wage performance, the people said, asking not to be named discussing sensitive matters. items.title: UK borrowing costs up after markets spooked by Reeves’s income tax U-turn
items.standfirst: Pound down 0.5% against dollar in early trading after chancellor drops plans for upcoming budgetUK politics live – latest updatesBritain’s borrowing costs have jumped while the pound has dropped after the chancellor’s extraordinary last-minute decision to ditch tax-raising plans in the upcoming budget.Interest rates on government bonds rose by more than 10 basis points in early trading, putting them on track for their worst day since 2 July, when investors responded to a tearful appearance by Rachel Reeves in the House of Commons chamber. The pound, meanwhile, dropped 0.5% against the dollar. Continue reading...
items.content: Pound down 0.5% against dollar in early trading after chancellor drops plans for upcoming budgetUK politics live – latest updatesBritain’s borrowing costs have jumped while the pound has dropped after the chancellor’s extraordinary last-minute decision to ditch tax-raising plans in the upcoming budget.Interest rates on government bonds rose by more than 10 basis points in early trading, putting them on track for their worst day since 2 July, when investors responded to a tearful appearance by Rachel Reeves in the House of Commons chamber. The pound, meanwhile, dropped 0.5% against the dollar. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Mining giant BHP liable for Brazil’s worst environmental disaster, UK court says
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Court Rules BHP Liable for Brazil Dam Collapse
bullet_summary: A judge has ruled that a company can be held liable for a dam collapse which devastated indigenous communities in Brazil and became the country's worst environmental catastrophe
Reported by France24, Reuters Top News, Sky News World

items.title: Mining giant BHP liable for Brazil’s worst environmental disaster, UK court says
items.standfirst: A British court ruled that global mining giant BHP is liable for the 2015 collapse of a dam in southeastern Brazil. The event was the country's worst environmental disaster, unleashing a wave of toxic sludge that killed 19 people and polluted the length of the Doce River.
items.content: A British court ruled that global mining giant BHP is liable for the 2015 collapse of a dam in southeastern Brazil. The event was the country's worst environmental disaster, unleashing a wave of toxic sludge that killed 19 people and polluted the length of the Doce River.

items.title: BBC apologises to Trump over edited speech but rejects compensation claim
items.standfirst: ‘We strongly disagree there is a basis for a defamation claim’, reads statement expressing ‘sincere regrets’ over Panorama episodeThe BBC has apologised to Donald Trump over the editing of a Panorama documentary that led to the resignation of its director general, Tim Davie, and the BBC News chief, Deborah Turness.However, the corporation has rejected his demands for compensation, after lawyers for Trump threatened to sue for $1bn (£760m) in damages unless the BBC issued a retraction, apologised and settled with him. clusters.neutral_headline: Judge Rules Against Apple, OpenAI in Musk's AI Lawsuit
bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, Bloomberg Technology

items.title: Elon Musk's X Clears First Hurdle In Lawsuit Accusing OpenAI And Apple Of AI Monopoly
items.standfirst: A federal judge has ruled against Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) and OpenAI, refusing to dismiss a lawsuit filed by Elon Musk’s X Corp. The lawsuit accuses the companies of conspiring to monopolize the smartphone and generative AI chatbot markets. Court To Resolve Factual Disagreements Later On…
items.content: A federal judge has ruled against Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) and OpenAI, refusing to dismiss a lawsuit filed by Elon Musk’s X Corp. The lawsuit accuses the companies of conspiring to monopolize the smartphone and generative AI chatbot markets. Court To Resolve Factual Disagreements Later On…

items.title: OpenAI, Apple Lose Bid to Toss Musk xAI Suit Over Competition
items.standfirst: Apple Inc. and OpenAI must answer to a lawsuit filed by Elon Musk’s X Corp. and xAI accusing the companies of conspiring to thwart competition in emerging markets in artificial intelligence, a federal judge in Texas ruled.
items.content: Apple Inc. and OpenAI must answer to a lawsuit filed by Elon Musk’s X Corp. and xAI accusing the companies of conspiring to thwart competition in emerging markets in artificial intelligence, a federal judge in Texas ruled.

ai_summary: A federal judge denied Apple and OpenAI's motion to dismiss Elon Musk's lawsuit.
The lawsuit alleges the companies conspired to monopolize AI and smartphone markets.
X Corp and xAI, led by Musk, filed the lawsuit against Apple and OpenAI.
The court will address factual disagreements at a later time.
The lawsuit accuses the companies of thwarting competition in emerging markets.

clusters.title: China investment falls by most since the pandemic
clusters.neutral_headline: China's Investment Experiences Largest Drop Since Pandemic
bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, Financial Times

items.title: China investment falls by most since the pandemic
China investment falls by most since the pandemic
items.standfirst: Weak housing prices and slowing industrial output point to flagging economic momentum
items.content: Weak housing prices and slowing industrial output point to flagging economic momentum

ai_summary: China's investment has fallen by the most since the pandemic began.
Weak housing prices are contributing to the decline in investment.
Slowing industrial output also indicates flagging economic momentum.
The economic indicators suggest a slowdown in China's growth.
The data points to potential challenges for China's economy.

clusters.title: US calls for international action to cut weapons supply to Sudan paramilitaries
clusters.neutral_headline: US Calls for Action to Cut Weapons to Sudan Paramilitaries
bullet_summary: A top adviser to the leader of the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, or RSF, has said US secretary of state Marco Rubio's remarks on halting weapons supplies "jeopardise ceasefire efforts"
Reported by BBC World, Sky News World

items.title: US calls for international action to cut weapons supply to Sudan paramilitaries
items.standfirst: "They're committing acts of sexual violence and atrocities," says the US secretary of state, "and it needs to end immediately".
items.content: "They're committing acts of sexual violence and atrocities," says the US secretary of state, "and it needs to end immediately".

items.title: Sudan's top paramilitary adviser says US calls to cut supply of weapons may 'jeopardise ceasefire'
items.standfirst: A top adviser to the leader of the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, or RSF, has said US secretary of state Marco Rubio's remarks on halting weapons supplies "jeopardise ceasefire efforts".
items.content: A top adviser to the leader of the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, or RSF, has said US secretary of state Marco Rubio's remarks on halting weapons supplies "jeopardise ceasefire efforts".

ai_summary: The United States calls for international action to stop weapons supplies to Sudan.
The US Secretary of State cited acts of sexual violence and atrocities.
A top paramilitary advisor said the US call may jeopardize ceasefire efforts.
The advisor represents the Rapid Support Forces in Sudan.
The US is seeking to end the violence in Sudan immediately.

clusters.title: Man who grabbed Ariana Grande in Singapore charged in court

items.title: Ariana Grande rushed by man at 'Wicked: For Good' premiere, is shielded by Cynthia Erivo
items.standfirst: Ariana Grande was shielded by her “Wicked: For Good” co-star Cynthia Erivo from an overzealous fan who rushed them at the Singapore premiere of their new movie
items.content: Ariana Grande was shielded by her “Wicked: For Good” co-star Cynthia Erivo from an overzealous fan who rushed them at the Singapore premiere of their new movie

ai_summary: A man rushed at Ariana Grande during a Singapore premiere.
The incident occurred at the Asia-Pacific premiere of "Wicked: For Good".
Cynthia Erivo shielded Ariana Grande from the overzealous fan.
The man was charged in court following the incident.
The premiere was for the new movie "Wicked: For Good".

clusters.title: Israel confirms identity of hostage body returned by Hamas as Meny Godard
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel Receives Body of Hostage Returned by Hamas
bullet_summary: Israel on Thursday received from the Red Cross the body of Meny Godard, one of the last four hostages held in Gaza, under a ceasefire deal with Hamas, the prime minister’s office said
Forensics confirmed Godard, 73, was killed during the October 7, 2023 Hamas-led attacks, it added

items.title: Israel confirms identity of hostage body returned by Hamas as Meny Godard
items.standfirst: Godard was 73 when he was killed during Hamas's raid on kibbutz Be'eri on 7 October 2023.
items.content: Godard was 73 when he was killed during Hamas's raid on kibbutz Be'eri on 7 October 2023.

items.title: Israel receives body of one of the last four hostages held in Gaza
items.standfirst: Israel on Thursday received from the Red Cross the body of Meny Godard, one of the last four hostages held in Gaza, under a ceasefire deal with Hamas, the prime minister’s office said. Forensics confirmed Godard, 73, was killed during the October 7, 2023 Hamas-led attacks, it added.
items.content: Israel on Thursday received from the Red Cross the body of Meny Godard, one of the last four hostages held in Gaza, under a ceasefire deal with Hamas, the prime minister’s office said. Forensics confirmed Godard, 73, was killed during the October 7, 2023 Hamas-led attacks, it added.

ai_summary: Israel received the body of Meny Godard from Hamas via the Red Cross.
Godard was one of the last four hostages held in Gaza.
He was killed during the October 7, 2023 Hamas-led attacks.
Forensics confirmed Godard's death during the attacks.
Godard was 73 years old when he was killed.

clusters.title: BBC apologises to Trump over documentary, rejects defamation claim
clusters.neutral_headline: BBC Apologizes to Trump, Rejects Defamation Claim
bullet_summary: In a letter, BBC said it had no plans to rebroadcast the documentary that was the basis of Trump's defamation claim
The BBC said on Thursday its chairman had apologised to US President Donald Trump for a misleading edit of one of his speeches, but denied it amounted to defamation
The broadcaster also said it was probing a possible second instance of a Trump speech edited in a misleading way

items.title: BBC apologises to Trump over documentary, rejects defamation claim
items.standfirst: In a letter, BBC said it had no plans to rebroadcast the documentary that was the basis of Trump's defamation claim.
items.content: In a letter, BBC said it had no plans to rebroadcast the documentary that was the basis of Trump's defamation claim.

items.title: BBC apologises to Trump over film edit but rejects defamation claim
items.standfirst: The BBC said on Thursday its chairman had apologised to US President Donald Trump for a misleading edit of one of his speeches, but denied it amounted to defamation. The broadcaster also said it was probing a possible second instance of a Trump speech edited in a misleading way.
items.content: The BBC said on Thursday its chairman had apologised to US President Donald Trump for a misleading edit of one of his speeches, but denied it amounted to defamation. The broadcaster also said it was probing a possible second instance of a Trump speech edited in a misleading way.

ai_summary: The BBC apologized to Donald Trump over a misleading documentary edit.
The BBC rejected Trump's defamation claim related to the documentary.
The BBC stated it would not rebroadcast the documentary.
The BBC is investigating a second instance of a misleading edit.
The BBC chairman offered the apology to the former US President.

clusters.title: Israeli president condemns ‘serious’ attack by settlers on West Bank villages
clusters.neutral_headline: Israeli Settlers Attack Palestinian Villages in West Bank
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, NBC World

items.title: Israeli president condemns ‘serious’ attack by settlers on West Bank villages
items.standfirst: Isaac Herzog makes rare statement on often-ignored violence as settlers injure Palestinians and attack soldiersDozens of masked Israeli settlers attacked Palestinian villages in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday, injuring four Palestinians and attacking Israeli soldiers in the latest incident of rising settler violence.The settlers attacked the Palestinian villages of Beit Lid and Deir Sharaf, setting vehicles on fire and damaging property belonging to a Bedouin community, with charred remains of cars left behind the next day. Continue reading...
items.content: Isaac Herzog makes rare statement on often-ignored violence as settlers injure Palestinians and attack soldiersDozens of masked Israeli settlers attacked Palestinian villages in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday, injuring four Palestinians and attacking Israeli soldiers in the latest incident of rising settler violence.The settlers attacked the Palestinian villages of Beit Lid and Deir Sharaf, setting vehicles on fire and damaging property belonging to a Bedouin community, with charred remains of cars left behind the next day. Continue reading...

items.title: Masked Israeli settlers attack Palestinian villages and IDF soldiers in the West Bank
items.standfirst: Settlers attacked Palestinians and set fire to property in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday before clashing with soldiers sent to break up their rampage.
items.content: Settlers attacked Palestinians and set fire to property in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday before clashing with soldiers sent to break up their rampage.

ai_summary: Israeli settlers attacked Palestinian villages in the occupied West Bank.
Settlers injured Palestinians and attacked Israeli soldiers.
The attacks occurred in the villages of Beit Lid and Deir Sharaf.
Settlers set vehicles on fire and damaged property.
The Israeli president condemned the "serious" settler attacks.

clusters.title: Trump writes to Israeli president calling for Netanyahu pardon
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Asks Israeli President to Pardon Netanyahu
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, Sky News World

items.title: Trump writes to Israeli president calling for Netanyahu pardon
items.standfirst: Isaac Herzog can pardon convicted criminals in some circumstances, but cases against Israeli PM are ongoingDonald Trump has repeated a request to Israel’s president, Isaac Herzog, for a pardon for Benjamin Netanyahu, who is on trial in three separate corruption cases.The Israeli prime minister has repeatedly denied any wrongdoing in the ongoing court cases. No rulings have been delivered, and his supporters have dismissed the trials as politically motivated. Continue reading...
items.content: Isaac Herzog can pardon convicted criminals in some circumstances, but cases against Israeli PM are ongoingDonald Trump has repeated a request to Israel’s president, Isaac Herzog, for a pardon for Benjamin Netanyahu, who is on trial in three separate corruption cases.The Israeli prime minister has repeatedly denied any wrongdoing in the ongoing court cases. No rulings have been delivered, and his supporters have dismissed the trials as politically motivated. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump asks Israeli president to 'fully pardon' Netanyahu in corruption trial
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has sent a letter to the Israeli president urging him to "fully pardon" Benjamin Netanyahu in his long-running corruption trial.
items.content: Donald Trump has sent a letter to the Israeli president urging him to "fully pardon" Benjamin Netanyahu in his long-running corruption trial.

ai_summary: Donald Trump requested a pardon for Benjamin Netanyahu from Israel's president.
Trump sent a letter to Israeli President Isaac Herzog.
Netanyahu is on trial in three separate corruption cases.
Trump asked for a "full pardon" for Netanyahu.
Netanyahu denies any wrongdoing in the ongoing court cases.
